directions: Prepare the soil by tilling and removing any rocks or debris.
Plant the wheat seeds in rows, leaving space between each seed.
Water the seeds thoroughly and provide them with adequate sunlight.
Continue to water the wheat plants regularly, ensuring they receive enough moisture but not too much.
Allow the wheat to grow for approximately 6 months, or until it has developed fully.
Once the wheat has ripened and turned golden in color, it is ready to be harvested.
Using a scythe or sickle, cut the wheat stalks close to the ground.
Gather the cut wheat stalks and separate the grains from the chaff.
Store the harvested wheat grains in a dry and cool place.
To use the wheat, grind it into flour or cook it as desired.
